title: @Ghostcrawler: Zed does NOT need buffs
body: I appreciate your concern and paying attention to Zed, but he needs NO change. No. Change. Lethality needs to change (which you are changing). Zed is still zed. He is high skill cap and the post rework put him in a great spot. Makes you focus on the ADC. I still perform VERY well with Zed, I have about a 65% winrate with him in ranked and mastery 7. He is still a solid champion.

replies.body: Picking Zed currently is a joke.  Like I appreciate that you can get a 65% wr with Zed in silver, but that doesn't prove anything.  He isn't worth picking vs decent players.

> It also limits zed's potential and forces him to focus AD targets just because you can steal their AD.

Shifting him away from "bully enemy mage into nonexistance" playstyle, and make him less generalist was exactly the point of this change.

Making picks more specialized increases diversity in any way imaginable.

And versatility, understood as champions who are good for any occasion, is not a design value.

Mages are heavily specialized. There was never a situation when one mage overshadowed whole class, because they have heavily diverse kits. Meanwhile Zed, whenever he is strong, is the only assassin worth taking mid, like it was back in season 6 and in season 3, excluding rare situations when you just can't afford AD mid and LB is better.

Hating on mages is completely irrelevant here - Zed was made more specialized for the sake of other midlane assassins.

That was the past when most of the assassins couldn't even survive in lane vs a mage.  And even then Lb was always the better pick.  Times have changed and now Zed isn't the only assassin that can win lane.

ok

can we make these guys {{champion:61}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:103}} less generalist too? 

being a single target assassin is bad but AoE "utility mage" nuking is a-ok?

Ahri doesn't AOE nuke though.

Veigar is better at making nope zones and nuking one person.

Ori has a teamwide nuke that can be carried in.

They are quite distinct.

There are crapton of reasons to pick other mages over those you pointed out.

But if Zed is strong, he overshadows all other assassins, and the only reason not to pick him as assassin player is because you are not mid.

That's the difference there.

no he doesn't, especially not now 

{{champion:55}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:121}} all do shit zed doesn't and they've been meta at the same time

I think Zed at his core is a much healthier champion than, say, Yasuo, Kat, or LeBlanc.

His problem is when his shurikens waveclear with zero risk and allow him to farm, resourceless, at a range because of shadows.

However, his kill combo is easy to counter (hourglass completely negates it, Janna completely negates it, CC him after he lands and he explodes, etc) and he will only really kill you if you're out of position.

That being said, he's terrible right now in every way.  He's a free lose if anyone is stupid enough to pick him.  I think he needs help, but his wave clear should never, ever be buffed.
Because you're silver. You're literally playing against some of the most unskilled players ever.

OP.gg says that Zed is sitting on a 50% winrate and 6% pick rate. Those are fair numbers for a high skillcap champ like Zed. Not quite sure why he needs buffed, unless Riot is trying to change him back into the monster he was in season 6.

I'm okay if that happens, since ten bans are coming soon. I would expect Zed mains to want to keep their champ at this level of power though, to avoid their main becoming near permaban status. Especially after next patch, when CoC gets nerfed and Poppy falls off the ban list (more than she has already).
